Key Match Events: Youri Tielemans opened the scoring for Belgium after 73 seconds
Kevin De Bruyne wrapped up the match for Belgium after 80 minutes
Romelu Lukaku had a third overturned goal of the tournament decided by VAR
Belgium had 20 shots and nine on target
Pre-Game Insights: Belgium manager Domenico Tedesco made four changes to his starting lineup, including restoring Jan Vertonghen to defense and adding Youri Tielemans alongside Amadou Onana in midfield
Tedesco insisted he was happy with Belgium's performance in the opening game, a 1-0 defeat to Slovakia
Post-Match Reflections: Tedesco expressed relief and happiness with the win, but frustration at Belgium's inability to kill the game earlier
De Bruyne praised his team's performance and said he thought he would go on a run to score
Lukaku's hold-up play, connection with his teammates, and dominant physical presence were a major influence on the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: Belgium's performance was described as 'electric' and'scintillating'
The match was marked by a series of presentable chances for Belgium, including a goal that was overturned by VAR
Belgium's win leaves Group E all square
